content: 4 Then called Moses unto Mishael､ and unto Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel､ uncle of Aaron,—and said unto them— Draw near､ bear away your brethren from before the sanctuary, unto the outside of the camp.
content_old: 4 Then called Moses unto Mishael､ and unto Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel､ uncle of Aaron,—and said unto them— Draw near､ bear away your brethren from before the sanctuary, unto the outside of the camp.

content: 5 So they drew near and bare them away､ in their tunics, unto the outside of the camp,—as spake Moses.
content_old: 5 So they drew near and bare them away､ in their tunics, unto the outside of the camp,—as spake Moses.

content: 6 Then said Moses unto Aaron､ and to Eleazar and to Ithamar､ his sons— Your heads ye may not bare and your garments ye shall not rend､ so shall ye not die, neither against all the assembly will he be wroth,—but let your brethren､ the whole house of Israel bewail the consuming fire wherewith Yahweh hath consumed.
content_old: 6 Then said Moses unto Aaron､ and to Eleazar and to Ithamar､ his sons— Your heads ye may not bare and your garments ye shall not rend､ so shall ye not die, neither against all the assembly will he be wroth,—but let your brethren､ the whole house of Israel bewail the consuming fire wherewith Yahweh hath consumed.

content: 7 But from the entrance of the tent of meeting shall ye not go forth､ lest ye die, for the anointing oil of Yahweh is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
content_old: 7 But from the entrance of the tent of meeting shall ye not go forth､ lest ye die, for the anointing oil of Yahweh is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.

content: 8 Then spake Yahweh unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 8 Then spake Yahweh unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 9 Wine and strong drink thou mayest not drink､—thou nor thy sons with thee when ye enter into the tent of meeting､ so shall ye not die,—an age-abiding statute､ to your generations;
content_old: 9 Wine and strong drink thou mayest not drink､—thou nor thy sons with thee when ye enter into the tent of meeting､ so shall ye not die,—an age-abiding statute､ to your generations;

content: 10 That ye may make a difference､ between the sacred and the common,—and between the unclean､ and the clean;
content_old: 10 That ye may make a difference､ between the sacred and the common,—and between the unclean､ and the clean;

content: 11 And may teach the sons of Israel,—all the statutes which Yahweh hath spoken unto them､ by the mediation of Moses.
content_old: 11 And may teach the sons of Israel,—all the statutes which Yahweh hath spoken unto them､ by the mediation of Moses.

content: 12 Then spake Moses unto Aaron､ and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar his sons､ that were left, Take ye the meal-offering that is left､ of the altar-flames of Yahweh, and eat it unleavened､ beside the altar,—for most holy it is;
content_old: 12 Then spake Moses unto Aaron､ and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar his sons､ that were left, Take ye the meal-offering that is left､ of the altar-flames of Yahweh, and eat it unleavened､ beside the altar,—for most holy it is;

content: 13 therefore shall ye eat it in a holy place, for thine by statute､ and thy sons’ by statute it is, from among the altar-flames of Yahweh,—for so am I commanded.
content_old: 13 therefore shall ye eat it in a holy place, for thine by statute､ and thy sons’ by statute it is, from among the altar-flames of Yahweh,—for so am I commanded.

content: 14 And the wave-breast､ and the heave-shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place, thou､ and thy sons and thy daughters with thee,—for as thine by statute､ and thy sons’ by statute have they been given, from among the peace-offerings of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 14 And the wave-breast､ and the heave-shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place, thou､ and thy sons and thy daughters with thee,—for as thine by statute､ and thy sons’ by statute have they been given, from among the peace-offerings of the sons of Israel.

content: 15 The heave-shoulder and the wave-breast､ upon the altar-flames of the fat portions shall they bring in, to wave as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh,—so shall they be thine､ and thy sons’ with thee､ by an age-abiding statute, As Yahweh hath commanded.
content_old: 15 The heave-shoulder and the wave-breast､ upon the altar-flames of the fat portions shall they bring in, to wave as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh,—so shall they be thine､ and thy sons’ with thee､ by an age-abiding statute, As Yahweh hath commanded.

content: 16 Now as for the sin-bearing goat Moses diligently sought it､ but lo! it had been burnt up,—then was he wroth against Eleazar and against Ithamar､ the sons of Aaron that were left､ saying:
content_old: 16 Now as for the sin-bearing goat Moses diligently sought it､ but lo! it had been burnt up,—then was he wroth against Eleazar and against Ithamar､ the sons of Aaron that were left､ saying:

content: 17 Wherefore did ye not eat the sin-bearer in the holy place? for most holy it is,—and the same hath he given you､ that ye may bear the iniquity of the assembly, to put a propitiatory-covering over them､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 17 Wherefore did ye not eat the sin-bearer in the holy place? for most holy it is,—and the same hath he given you､ that ye may bear the iniquity of the assembly, to put a propitiatory-covering over them､ before Yahweh.

content: 18 Lo! the blood thereof had not been taken into the holy place､within,—ye should have indeed eaten it､ in a holy place､ as I commanded.
content_old: 18 Lo! the blood thereof had not been taken into the holy place､within,—ye should have indeed eaten it､ in a holy place､ as I commanded.

content: 19 Then spake Aaron unto Moses— Lo! this very day､ when they had brought near their own sin-bearer､ and their own ascending-sacrifice there befell me such things as these,—if､ then､ I had eaten of the sin-bearer this day would it have been well-pleasing in the eyes of Yahweh?
content_old: 19 Then spake Aaron unto Moses— Lo! this very day､ when they had brought near their own sin-bearer､ and their own ascending-sacrifice there befell me such things as these,—if､ then､ I had eaten of the sin-bearer this day would it have been well-pleasing in the eyes of Yahweh?

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying unto them:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying unto them:

content: 2 Speak ye unto the sons of Israel､ saying,— These are the living things which ye may eat, of all the beasts which are upon the earth:
content_old: 2 Speak ye unto the sons of Israel､ saying,— These are the living things which ye may eat, of all the beasts which are upon the earth:

content: 3 Whatsoever parteth the hoof､ and is cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud､ among beasts that may ye eat.
content_old: 3 Whatsoever parteth the hoof､ and is cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud､ among beasts that may ye eat.

content: 4 Nevertheless these shall ye not eat, of them that chew the cud､ and of them that part the hoof,— The camel because though he cheweth the cud yet the hoof he parteth not, unclean he is to you;
content_old: 4 Nevertheless these shall ye not eat, of them that chew the cud､ and of them that part the hoof,— The camel because though he cheweth the cud yet the hoof he parteth not, unclean he is to you;

content: 5 And the coney because though he cheweth the cud yet the hoof he parteth not,—unclean he is to you;
content_old: 5 And the coney because though he cheweth the cud yet the hoof he parteth not,—unclean he is to you;

content: 6 And the hare because though she cheweth the cud yet the hoof she parteth not,—unclean she is to you;
content_old: 6 And the hare because though she cheweth the cud yet the hoof she parteth not,—unclean she is to you;

content: 7 And the swine because though he parteth the hoof and is cloven-footed yet the cud he cheweth not,—unclean he is to you;
content_old: 7 And the swine because though he parteth the hoof and is cloven-footed yet the cud he cheweth not,—unclean he is to you;

content: 8 Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch,���unclean they are to you.
content_old: 8 Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch,���unclean they are to you.

content: 9 These may ye eat, of all that are in the waters,—all that have fins and scales､ in the waters, in the seas and in the rivers them may ye eat.
content_old: 9 These may ye eat, of all that are in the waters,—all that have fins and scales､ in the waters, in the seas and in the rivers them may ye eat.

content: 10 But all that have not fins and scales､ in the seas and in the rivers, of all that swarm in the waters, and of all the living souls that are in the waters an abomination they are unto you;
content_old: 10 But all that have not fins and scales､ in the seas and in the rivers, of all that swarm in the waters, and of all the living souls that are in the waters an abomination they are unto you;

content: 11 and an abomination shall they remain to you,—of their flesh ye shall not eat, and their carcases shall ye abhor.
content_old: 11 and an abomination shall they remain to you,—of their flesh ye shall not eat, and their carcases shall ye abhor.

content: 12 Whatsoever hath not fins and scales､ in the waters an abomination it is unto you.
content_old: 12 Whatsoever hath not fins and scales､ in the waters an abomination it is unto you.

content: 13 And these shall ye abhor of birds, they shall not be eaten､ an abomination they are,—the eagle､ and the ossifrage, and the osprey;
content_old: 13 And these shall ye abhor of birds, they shall not be eaten､ an abomination they are,—the eagle､ and the ossifrage, and the osprey;

content: 14 and the vulture, and the falcon､ after its kind;
content_old: 14 and the vulture, and the falcon､ after its kind;

content: 15 every raven, after its kind;
content_old: 15 every raven, after its kind;

content: 16 and the female ostrich, and the male ostrich､ and the sea-gull,—and the hawk､ after its kind;
content_old: 16 and the female ostrich, and the male ostrich､ and the sea-gull,—and the hawk､ after its kind;

content: 17 and the pelican､ and the gannet, and the bittern;
content_old: 17 and the pelican､ and the gannet, and the bittern;

content: 18 and the swan and the vomiting pelican､ and the little vulture;
content_old: 18 and the swan and the vomiting pelican､ and the little vulture;

content: 19 and the stork, and the parrot､ after its kind,—and the mountain-cock､ and the bat.
content_old: 19 and the stork, and the parrot､ after its kind,—and the mountain-cock､ and the bat.

content: 20 Every creeping thing that flieth, that goeth on all-fours an abomination it is unto you.
content_old: 20 Every creeping thing that flieth, that goeth on all-fours an abomination it is unto you.

content: 21 Nevertheless these may ye eat, of all creeping things that fly, that go on all-fours—such as have legs above their feet, to leap therewith､ upon the earth—
content_old: 21 Nevertheless these may ye eat, of all creeping things that fly, that go on all-fours—such as have legs above their feet, to leap therewith､ upon the earth—

content: 22 these of them may ye eat: the swarming-locust after its kind, and the devouring locust after its kind,— and the chargol-locust after its kind, and the chagab-locust after its kind.
content_old: 22 these of them may ye eat: the swarming-locust after its kind, and the devouring locust after its kind,— and the chargol-locust after its kind, and the chagab-locust after its kind.

content: 23 But every other creeping thing that flieth, which hath four feet an abomination it is unto you;
content_old: 23 But every other creeping thing that flieth, which hath four feet an abomination it is unto you;

content: 24 and for these shall ye count yourselves unclean—whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 24 and for these shall ye count yourselves unclean—whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the evening;

content: 25 and whosoever beareth away aught of the carcase of them shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 25 and whosoever beareth away aught of the carcase of them shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 26 As for every kind of beast which though it parteth the hoof yet is not cloven-footed､ nor cheweth the cud unclean they are unto you,—every one who toucheth them shall be unclean.
content_old: 26 As for every kind of beast which though it parteth the hoof yet is not cloven-footed､ nor cheweth the cud unclean they are unto you,—every one who toucheth them shall be unclean.

content: 27 And all that go upon their paws､ among all the living things that go on all-fours unclean they are unto you,—whoso toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 27 And all that go upon their paws､ among all the living things that go on all-fours unclean they are unto you,—whoso toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the evening.

content: 28 And he that beareth away the carcase of them shall wash his clothes､ and shall be unclean until the evening,—unclean they are unto you.
content_old: 28 And he that beareth away the carcase of them shall wash his clothes､ and shall be unclean until the evening,—unclean they are unto you.

content: 29 And these unto you shall be unclean, among the creeping things that creep upon the earth,—the weazel and the mouse､ and the lizard after its kind;
content_old: 29 And these unto you shall be unclean, among the creeping things that creep upon the earth,—the weazel and the mouse､ and the lizard after its kind;

content: 30 and the ferret and the chameleon､ and the wall-lizard,—and the winding lizard､ and the mole.
content_old: 30 and the ferret and the chameleon､ and the wall-lizard,—and the winding lizard､ and the mole.

content: 31 These are､ they which are unclean to you､ among all that creep,—whosoever toucheth them when they are dead shall be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 31 These are､ they which are unclean to you､ among all that creep,—whosoever toucheth them when they are dead shall be unclean until the evening;

content: 32 and everything whereon any of them shall fall when they are dead shall be unclean—of any articles of wood､ or cloth､ or skin､ or sackcloth, any article wherewith any work is done—shall be put in water and shall be unclean until the evening､ and then be clean.
content_old: 32 and everything whereon any of them shall fall when they are dead shall be unclean—of any articles of wood､ or cloth､ or skin､ or sackcloth, any article wherewith any work is done—shall be put in water and shall be unclean until the evening､ and then be clean.

content: 33 And as for any earthen vessel whereinto any of them may fall everything therein shall be unclean､ and the vessel itself shall ye break in pieces.
content_old: 33 And as for any earthen vessel whereinto any of them may fall everything therein shall be unclean､ and the vessel itself shall ye break in pieces.

content: 34 Of all the food that may be eaten, that whereon shall come water shall be unclean,—and all drink which might be drunk in any such vessel shall be unclean.
content_old: 34 Of all the food that may be eaten, that whereon shall come water shall be unclean,—and all drink which might be drunk in any such vessel shall be unclean.

content: 35 And everything whereon shall fall any part of the carcase of them shall be unclean, oven or fire-range it shall be destroyed､unclean they are,—and unclean shall they remain to you.
content_old: 35 And everything whereon shall fall any part of the carcase of them shall be unclean, oven or fire-range it shall be destroyed､unclean they are,—and unclean shall they remain to you.

content: 36 Notwithstanding a fountain or cistern wherein is a gathering of waters shall be clean,—but he that toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean.
content_old: 36 Notwithstanding a fountain or cistern wherein is a gathering of waters shall be clean,—but he that toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean.

content: 37 And when any part of the carcase of them shall fall upon seed for sowing､ which is to be sown the same is clean.
content_old: 37 And when any part of the carcase of them shall fall upon seed for sowing､ which is to be sown the same is clean.

content: 38 But when water shall be put upon seed, and there shall fall thereon any part of the carcase of them unclean it is to you.
content_old: 38 But when water shall be put upon seed, and there shall fall thereon any part of the carcase of them unclean it is to you.

content: 39 And when any of the beasts which are yours for food shall die he that toucheth the carcase of it shall be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 39 And when any of the beasts which are yours for food shall die he that toucheth the carcase of it shall be unclean until the evening.

content: 40 And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening,—he also that carrieth away the carcase thereof shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 40 And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening,—he also that carrieth away the carcase thereof shall wash his clothes､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 41 And any creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth an abomination it is—it shall not be eaten.
content_old: 41 And any creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth an abomination it is—it shall not be eaten.

content: 42 Everything that goeth upon the belly､ and everything that goeth upon all-fours､ even to everything having many feet, as regardeth any creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth ye shall not eat them､ for an abomination they are.
content_old: 42 Everything that goeth upon the belly､ and everything that goeth upon all-fours､ even to everything having many feet, as regardeth any creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth ye shall not eat them､ for an abomination they are.

content: 43 Do not make your persons abominable, with any creeping thing that creepeth,—neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should become unclean thereby.
content_old: 43 Do not make your persons abominable, with any creeping thing that creepeth,—neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should become unclean thereby.

content: 44 For I—Yahweh am your God, therefore shall ye hallow yourselves and remain holy; for holy am I,—therefore shall ye not make your persons unclean, with any creeping thing that crawleth upon the earth;
content_old: 44 For I—Yahweh am your God, therefore shall ye hallow yourselves and remain holy; for holy am I,—therefore shall ye not make your persons unclean, with any creeping thing that crawleth upon the earth;

content: 45 for I—Yahweh am he that brought you up out of the land of Egypt, that I might become your God,—therefore shall ye be holy, for holy am I.
content_old: 45 for I—Yahweh am he that brought you up out of the land of Egypt, that I might become your God,—therefore shall ye be holy, for holy am I.

content: 46 This is the law of beast and of bird, and of every living soul that moveth in the waters,—and as to every soul that creepeth upon the earth:
content_old: 46 This is the law of beast and of bird, and of every living soul that moveth in the waters,—and as to every soul that creepeth upon the earth:

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ saying: A woman when she conceiveth seed､ and giveth birth to a male child then shall she be unclean seven days, according to the days of her removal in her sickness shall she be unclean.
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ saying: A woman when she conceiveth seed､ and giveth birth to a male child then shall she be unclean seven days, according to the days of her removal in her sickness shall she be unclean.

content: 3 And on the eighth day shall the flesh of his foreskin be circumcised. And for thirty-three days
content_old: 3 And on the eighth day shall the flesh of his foreskin be circumcised. And for thirty-three days

content: 4 shall she continue in the blood of purification,—no hallowed thing shall she touch､ and into the sanctuary shall she not enter, until her days of purification are fulfilled.
content_old: 4 shall she continue in the blood of purification,—no hallowed thing shall she touch､ and into the sanctuary shall she not enter, until her days of purification are fulfilled.

content: 5 But if a female child she bear then shall she be unclean two weeks､ as in her removal,—and for sixty-six days shall she continue in the blood of purification.
content_old: 5 But if a female child she bear then shall she be unclean two weeks､ as in her removal,—and for sixty-six days shall she continue in the blood of purification.

content: 6 And when the days of her purification are fulfilled､ whether for a son or for a daughter she shall bring in a lamb､ the choice of its year､ as an ascending-sacrifice, and a young pigeon or a turtle-dove､ as a sin-bearer, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting､ unto the priest;
content_old: 6 And when the days of her purification are fulfilled､ whether for a son or for a daughter she shall bring in a lamb､ the choice of its year､ as an ascending-sacrifice, and a young pigeon or a turtle-dove､ as a sin-bearer, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting､ unto the priest;

content: 7 and he shall bring it near before Yahweh､ so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over her, and she shall be clean from her fountain of blood. This is the law for her that hath given birth, to a male child or to a female.
content_old: 7 and he shall bring it near before Yahweh､ so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over her, and she shall be clean from her fountain of blood. This is the law for her that hath given birth, to a male child or to a female.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying—
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying—

content: 2 When any man shall have—in the skin of his flesh—a rising､ or a scab､ or a bright spot, and it shall become in the skin of his flesh the plague-spot of leprosy then shall he be brought in unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests;
content_old: 2 When any man shall have—in the skin of his flesh—a rising､ or a scab､ or a bright spot, and it shall become in the skin of his flesh the plague-spot of leprosy then shall he be brought in unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests;

content: 3 and the priest shall view the spot in the skin of his flesh—if the hair in the plague have turned white and the appearance of the spot be deeper than the skin of his flesh the plague-spot of leprosy it is,—so the priest shall view him､ and pronounce him unclean.
content_old: 3 and the priest shall view the spot in the skin of his flesh—if the hair in the plague have turned white and the appearance of the spot be deeper than the skin of his flesh the plague-spot of leprosy it is,—so the priest shall view him､ and pronounce him unclean.

content: 4 But if the bright spot, though white in the skin of his flesh, is not deeper in appearance than the skin, and the hair hath not turned white then shall the priest shut up the plagued one､ seven days.
content_old: 4 But if the bright spot, though white in the skin of his flesh, is not deeper in appearance than the skin, and the hair hath not turned white then shall the priest shut up the plagued one､ seven days.

content: 5 And the priest shall view him on the seventh day, and lo! if the spot hath stayed to his sight, and the spot hath not spread in the skin then shall the priest shut him up seven days､ more
content_old: 5 And the priest shall view him on the seventh day, and lo! if the spot hath stayed to his sight, and the spot hath not spread in the skin then shall the priest shut him up seven days､ more

content: 6 Then shall the priest view him､ on the seventh day､ a second time, and lo! if the spot is faint, and the spot hath not spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him clean—it is a scab, and he shall wash his clothes､ and be clean.
content_old: 6 Then shall the priest view him､ on the seventh day､ a second time, and lo! if the spot is faint, and the spot hath not spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him clean—it is a scab, and he shall wash his clothes､ and be clean.

content: 7 But if the scab shall have verily spread in the skin, since he was shown to the priest that he might be cleansed then shall he shew himself again unto the priest;
content_old: 7 But if the scab shall have verily spread in the skin, since he was shown to the priest that he might be cleansed then shall he shew himself again unto the priest;

content: 8 and the priest shall take a view, and lo! if the scab hath spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—leprosy it is.
content_old: 8 and the priest shall take a view, and lo! if the scab hath spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—leprosy it is.

content: 9 When the plague of leprosy cometh to be in any human being then shall he be brought in unto the priest;
content_old: 9 When the plague of leprosy cometh to be in any human being then shall he be brought in unto the priest;

content: 10 and the priest shall take a view､ and lo! if there is a white rising in the skin and the same hath turned the hair white,—and there be a wound of raw flesh､ in the rising
content_old: 10 and the priest shall take a view､ and lo! if there is a white rising in the skin and the same hath turned the hair white,—and there be a wound of raw flesh､ in the rising

content: 11 an old leprosy it is in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean,—he shall not shut him up, for unclean he is.
content_old: 11 an old leprosy it is in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean,—he shall not shut him up, for unclean he is.

content: 12 But if the leprosy cometh quite out in the skin, and the leprosy covereth all the skin of him that is plagued, from his head even unto his feet,—so far as appeareth to the eyes of the priest
content_old: 12 But if the leprosy cometh quite out in the skin, and the leprosy covereth all the skin of him that is plagued, from his head even unto his feet,—so far as appeareth to the eyes of the priest

content: 13 then shall the priest take a view､ and lo! if the leprosy hath covered all his flesh then shall he pronounce clean him that was plagued,—all of it hath turned white､clean he is.
content_old: 13 then shall the priest take a view､ and lo! if the leprosy hath covered all his flesh then shall he pronounce clean him that was plagued,—all of it hath turned white､clean he is.

content: 14 But the very day there appeareth in him raw flesh he shall be unclean;
content_old: 14 But the very day there appeareth in him raw flesh he shall be unclean;

content: 15 so then the priest shall view the raw flesh､ and pronounce him unclean,—as for the raw flesh unclean it is leprosy it is.
content_old: 15 so then the priest shall view the raw flesh､ and pronounce him unclean,—as for the raw flesh unclean it is leprosy it is.

content: 16 Or if the raw flesh turn again､ and be changed to white then shall he come in unto the priest;
content_old: 16 Or if the raw flesh turn again､ and be changed to white then shall he come in unto the priest;

content: 17 and the priest shall view him, and Io! if the spot hath changed to white then shall the priest pronounce clean him that was plagued—clean he is.
content_old: 17 and the priest shall view him, and Io! if the spot hath changed to white then shall the priest pronounce clean him that was plagued—clean he is.

content: 18 And when any one’s flesh hath､ in the skin thereof､ a boil,—and then it is healed;
content_old: 18 And when any one’s flesh hath､ in the skin thereof､ a boil,—and then it is healed;

content: 19 but in the place of the boil is a white rising､ or a bright spot､ reddish white then shall it be shown unto the priest.
content_old: 19 but in the place of the boil is a white rising､ or a bright spot､ reddish white then shall it be shown unto the priest.

content: 20 And the priest shall take a view､ and lo! if the appearance thereof is lower than the skin, and the hair thereof hath turned white then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—the plague-spot of leprosy it､ is in the boil broken out.
content_old: 20 And the priest shall take a view､ and lo! if the appearance thereof is lower than the skin, and the hair thereof hath turned white then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—the plague-spot of leprosy it､ is in the boil broken out.

content: 21 But if the priest shall view it､ and lo! there is no white hair therein, and it is not deeper than the skin､ and in itself is faint then shall the priest shut him up seven days;
content_old: 21 But if the priest shall view it､ and lo! there is no white hair therein, and it is not deeper than the skin､ and in itself is faint then shall the priest shut him up seven days;

content: 22 and if it clearly spreadeth in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—a plague-spot it is.
content_old: 22 and if it clearly spreadeth in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean—a plague-spot it is.

content: 23 But if in its place､ the bright spot stayeth､ hath not spread a boil it is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
content_old: 23 But if in its place､ the bright spot stayeth､ hath not spread a boil it is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

content: 24 Or when any one’s flesh hath in the skin thereof､ a fiery burning,—and the burning wound becometh a bright spot､ reddish white､ or white
content_old: 24 Or when any one’s flesh hath in the skin thereof､ a fiery burning,—and the burning wound becometh a bright spot､ reddish white､ or white

content: 25 then shall the priest view it—and lo! if the hair is turned white in the bright spot､ and the appearance thereof is deeper than the skin leprosy it is, broken out in the burning,—so the priest shall pronounce him unclean, the plague-spot of leprosy it is.
content_old: 25 then shall the priest view it—and lo! if the hair is turned white in the bright spot､ and the appearance thereof is deeper than the skin leprosy it is, broken out in the burning,—so the priest shall pronounce him unclean, the plague-spot of leprosy it is.

content: 26 But if the priest shall view it､ and lo! there is not､ in the bright spot､ white hair, and it is not deeper than the skin､ but itself is faint then shall the priest shut him up seven days;
content_old: 26 But if the priest shall view it､ and lo! there is not､ in the bright spot､ white hair, and it is not deeper than the skin､ but itself is faint then shall the priest shut him up seven days;

content: 27 and the priest shall view him on the seventh day,—if it hath plainly spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean, the plague-spot of leprosy it is.
content_old: 27 and the priest shall view him on the seventh day,—if it hath plainly spread in the skin then shall the priest pronounce him unclean, the plague-spot of leprosy it is.

content: 28 But if､ in its place､ the bright spot hath stayed, and hath not spread in the skin､ but itself is faint the rising of a burning it is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean, for only the inflaming of the burning it is.
content_old: 28 But if､ in its place､ the bright spot hath stayed, and hath not spread in the skin､ but itself is faint the rising of a burning it is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean, for only the inflaming of the burning it is.

content: 29 And when there cometh to be in any man or woman a spot,—in the head､ or in the beard
content_old: 29 And when there cometh to be in any man or woman a spot,—in the head､ or in the beard

content: 30 then shall the priest view the spot､ and lo! if the appearance thereof is deeper than the skin, and therein is yellow､ thin hair then shall the priest pronounce him unclean､a scall it is, a leprosy of the head or of the beard it is.
content_old: 30 then shall the priest view the spot､ and lo! if the appearance thereof is deeper than the skin, and therein is yellow､ thin hair then shall the priest pronounce him unclean､a scall it is, a leprosy of the head or of the beard it is.

content: 31 But when the priest vieweth the spot, and lo! there is no appearance of it deeper than the skin, and no dark hair is therein then shall the priest shut up him that hath the plague-spot of scall､ seven days;
content_old: 31 But when the priest vieweth the spot, and lo! there is no appearance of it deeper than the skin, and no dark hair is therein then shall the priest shut up him that hath the plague-spot of scall､ seven days;

content: 32 and the priest shall view the spot on the seventh day, and lo! if the scall hath not spread, and there hath not come to be therein yellow hair,—and the appearance of the scall is not deeper than the skin
content_old: 32 and the priest shall view the spot on the seventh day, and lo! if the scall hath not spread, and there hath not come to be therein yellow hair,—and the appearance of the scall is not deeper than the skin

content: 33 then shall he shave himself, but the scall shall he not shave､—and the priest shall shut up him who hath the scall seven days､ more;
content_old: 33 then shall he shave himself, but the scall shall he not shave､—and the priest shall shut up him who hath the scall seven days､ more;

content: 34 then shall the priest view the scall, on the seventh day､ and lo! if the scall hath not spread in the skin, and the appearance thereof is not deeper than the skin then shall the priest pronounce him clean, and he shall wash his clothes､ and be clean.
content_old: 34 then shall the priest view the scall, on the seventh day､ and lo! if the scall hath not spread in the skin, and the appearance thereof is not deeper than the skin then shall the priest pronounce him clean, and he shall wash his clothes､ and be clean.

content: 35 But if the scall do indeed spread in the skin,—after he hath been pronounced clean
content_old: 35 But if the scall do indeed spread in the skin,—after he hath been pronounced clean

content: 36 then shall the priest take a view, and lo! if the scall hath spread in the skin the priest shall not search for the yellow hair—unclean he is.
content_old: 36 then shall the priest take a view, and lo! if the scall hath spread in the skin the priest shall not search for the yellow hair—unclean he is.

content: 37 But if in his eyes the scall is at a stay､ and dark hair hath grown up therein the scall is healed､ clean he is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
content_old: 37 But if in his eyes the scall is at a stay､ and dark hair hath grown up therein the scall is healed､ clean he is,—and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

content: 38 And when either man or woman hath in the skin of their flesh､ bright spots,—bright spots that are white
content_old: 38 And when either man or woman hath in the skin of their flesh､ bright spots,—bright spots that are white

content: 39 then shall the priest take a view､ and lo! if in the skin of their flesh are bright spots､ that are dull white dead white spot it is､ that hath broken through in the skin､—clean he is.
content_old: 39 then shall the priest take a view､ and lo! if in the skin of their flesh are bright spots､ that are dull white dead white spot it is､ that hath broken through in the skin､—clean he is.

content: 40 And when any man’s head loseth its hair though bald､ he is clean.
content_old: 40 And when any man’s head loseth its hair though bald､ he is clean.

content: 41 And if in front his head loseth its hair though bald in the forehead､ he is clean.
content_old: 41 And if in front his head loseth its hair though bald in the forehead､ he is clean.

content: 42 But should there be in the baldness behind､ or in the baldness in front a spot､ that is reddish white leprosy broken out it is, in his baldness behind､ or in his baldness in front.
content_old: 42 But should there be in the baldness behind､ or in the baldness in front a spot､ that is reddish white leprosy broken out it is, in his baldness behind､ or in his baldness in front.

content: 43 So the priest shall view it､ and lo! if the rising-spot be reddish white in his baldness behind､ or in his baldness in front,—like the appearance of leprosy in the skin of the flesh
content_old: 43 So the priest shall view it､ and lo! if the rising-spot be reddish white in his baldness behind､ or in his baldness in front,—like the appearance of leprosy in the skin of the flesh

content: 44 a leprous man is he､ unclean he is,—unclean shall the priest pronounce him､in his head is his plague.
content_old: 44 a leprous man is he､ unclean he is,—unclean shall the priest pronounce him､in his head is his plague.

content: 45 Now as for the leper in whom is the plague His clothes shall be rent､ And his head shall be bare, And his beard shall he cover,— And Unclean! Unclean! shall he cry.
content_old: 45 Now as for the leper in whom is the plague His clothes shall be rent､ And his head shall be bare, And his beard shall he cover,— And Unclean! Unclean! shall he cry.

content: 46 All the days that the plague is in him shall he continue unclean､ Unclean he is,— Alone shall he remain, Outside the camp shall be his dwelling.
content_old: 46 All the days that the plague is in him shall he continue unclean､ Unclean he is,— Alone shall he remain, Outside the camp shall be his dwelling.

content: 47 And when in a garment there is a plague-spot of leprosy,—whether in a garment of wool, or a garment of flax;
content_old: 47 And when in a garment there is a plague-spot of leprosy,—whether in a garment of wool, or a garment of flax;

content: 48 either in warp or in weft, made with flax､ or with wool,—or in a skin, or in anything wrought of skin;
content_old: 48 either in warp or in weft, made with flax､ or with wool,—or in a skin, or in anything wrought of skin;

content: 49 and the spot cometh to be of a greenish yellow or reddish､ in the garment or in the skin､ whether in warp or in weft､ or in any utensil of skin the plague-spot of leprosy it is,—and shall be shown unto the priest;
content_old: 49 and the spot cometh to be of a greenish yellow or reddish､ in the garment or in the skin､ whether in warp or in weft､ or in any utensil of skin the plague-spot of leprosy it is,—and shall be shown unto the priest;

content: 50 and the priest shall view the spot,—and shall shut up him that is plagued､ seven days;
content_old: 50 and the priest shall view the spot,—and shall shut up him that is plagued､ seven days;

content: 51 then shall he view the spot､ on the seventh day if the spot hath spread in the garment､ whether in warp or in weft､ or in the skin, or anything which may be made of skin for service the spot is a fretting leprosy unclean it is.
content_old: 51 then shall he view the spot､ on the seventh day if the spot hath spread in the garment､ whether in warp or in weft､ or in the skin, or anything which may be made of skin for service the spot is a fretting leprosy unclean it is.

content: 52 Then shall he burn up the garment､ whether it be in the warp or the weft､ in wool or in flax, or any utensil of skin, wherein shall be the plague-spot,—for a fretting leprosy it is, in fire shall it be burnt up.
content_old: 52 Then shall he burn up the garment､ whether it be in the warp or the weft､ in wool or in flax, or any utensil of skin, wherein shall be the plague-spot,—for a fretting leprosy it is, in fire shall it be burnt up.

content: 53 But if the priest shall take a view, and lo! the spot has not spread, in the garment､ either in warp or in weft,—or in any utensil of skin
content_old: 53 But if the priest shall take a view, and lo! the spot has not spread, in the garment､ either in warp or in weft,—or in any utensil of skin

content: 54 then shall the priest give command, and they shall wash that wherein is the spot,—and he shall shut it up seven days､ more;
content_old: 54 then shall the priest give command, and they shall wash that wherein is the spot,—and he shall shut it up seven days､ more;

content: 55 then shall the priest take a view､ after the plagued garment hath been washed､ and lo! if the spot hath not changed its look, then though the spot hath not spread yet unclean it is, in the fire shalt thou burn it up,—a sunken spot it is, in the back thereof､ or in the front thereof.
content_old: 55 then shall the priest take a view､ after the plagued garment hath been washed､ and lo! if the spot hath not changed its look, then though the spot hath not spread yet unclean it is, in the fire shalt thou burn it up,—a sunken spot it is, in the back thereof､ or in the front thereof.

content: 56 And if the priest hath taken a view, and lo! the spot is faint since it hath been washed, then shall he rend it out of the garment､ or out of the skin, whether out of the warp or out of the weft;
content_old: 56 And if the priest hath taken a view, and lo! the spot is faint since it hath been washed, then shall he rend it out of the garment､ or out of the skin, whether out of the warp or out of the weft;

content: 57 and if it appear still in the garment—either in the warp or in the weft､ or in any utensil of skin a breaking out it is,—in the fire shalt thou burn up that wherein is the plague.
content_old: 57 and if it appear still in the garment—either in the warp or in the weft､ or in any utensil of skin a breaking out it is,—in the fire shalt thou burn up that wherein is the plague.

content: 58 But as for the garment—whether the warp or the weft､ or any utensil of skin which thou shalt wash, and the plague shall depart therefrom then shall it be washed a second time､ and shall be clean.
content_old: 58 But as for the garment—whether the warp or the weft､ or any utensil of skin which thou shalt wash, and the plague shall depart therefrom then shall it be washed a second time､ and shall be clean.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, saying—
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, saying—

content: 2 This shall be the law of the leper, in the day when he is declared clean,—He shall be brought in unto the priest;
content_old: 2 This shall be the law of the leper, in the day when he is declared clean,—He shall be brought in unto the priest;

content: 3 then shall the priest go forth unto the outside of the camp,—and the priest shall take a view, and lo! if the plague of leprosy hath been healed out of the leper;
content_old: 3 then shall the priest go forth unto the outside of the camp,—and the priest shall take a view, and lo! if the plague of leprosy hath been healed out of the leper;

content: 4 then shall the priest give command,—and there shall be taken—for him that is to be cleansed—two living clean birds,—and cedar wood, and crimson､ and hyssop;
content_old: 4 then shall the priest give command,—and there shall be taken—for him that is to be cleansed—two living clean birds,—and cedar wood, and crimson､ and hyssop;

content: 5 and the priest shall give command, and one bird shall be slain,—within an earthen vessel､ over living water:
content_old: 5 and the priest shall give command, and one bird shall be slain,—within an earthen vessel､ over living water:

content: 6 as for the living bird he shall take it, and the cedar wood､ and the crimson, and the hyssop,—and shall dip them､ and the living bird､ in the blood of the bird that hath been slain over the living water;
content_old: 6 as for the living bird he shall take it, and the cedar wood､ and the crimson, and the hyssop,—and shall dip them､ and the living bird､ in the blood of the bird that hath been slain over the living water;

content: 7 and shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy､ seven times,—and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let go the living bird､ over the face of the field.
content_old: 7 and shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy､ seven times,—and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let go the living bird､ over the face of the field.

content: 8 And he that is to be declared clean shall wash his clothes､ and shave off all his hair, and bathe in water､ and be clean, and afterwards shall he come into the camp,—and dwell outside his tent､ seven days;
content_old: 8 And he that is to be declared clean shall wash his clothes､ and shave off all his hair, and bathe in water､ and be clean, and afterwards shall he come into the camp,—and dwell outside his tent､ seven days;

content: 9 and it shall be on the seventh day that he shall shave off all the hair of his head､ and his beard､ and his eyebrows, even all his hair shall he shave off,—and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe his flesh in water､ so shall he be clean.
content_old: 9 and it shall be on the seventh day that he shall shave off all the hair of his head､ and his beard､ and his eyebrows, even all his hair shall he shave off,—and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe his flesh in water､ so shall he be clean.

content: 10 And on the eighth day he shall take two he-lambs､ without defect, and one ewe-lamb､ the choice of its year､ without defect,—and three-tenths of fine meal for a meal-offering､ overflowed with oil, and one log of oil.
content_old: 10 And on the eighth day he shall take two he-lambs､ without defect, and one ewe-lamb､ the choice of its year､ without defect,—and three-tenths of fine meal for a meal-offering､ overflowed with oil, and one log of oil.

content: 11 And the priest that is cleansing him shall cause the man that is to be cleansed､ and those things､ to stand before Yahweh, at the opening of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 11 And the priest that is cleansing him shall cause the man that is to be cleansed､ and those things､ to stand before Yahweh, at the opening of the tent of meeting.

content: 12 And the priest shall take one he-lamb, and bring him near as a guilt-bearer､ and the log of oil,—and shall wave them as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh;
content_old: 12 And the priest shall take one he-lamb, and bring him near as a guilt-bearer､ and the log of oil,—and shall wave them as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh;

content: 13 and shall slay the lamb in the place where the sin-bearer and the ascending-sacrifice are slain, in the holy place,—for like the sin-bearer the guilt-bearer is the priest’s, most holy it is.
content_old: 13 and shall slay the lamb in the place where the sin-bearer and the ascending-sacrifice are slain, in the holy place,—for like the sin-bearer the guilt-bearer is the priest’s, most holy it is.

content: 14 Then shall the priest take of the blood of the guilt-bearer, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed,—and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot;
content_old: 14 Then shall the priest take of the blood of the guilt-bearer, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed,—and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot;

content: 15 and the priest shall take of the log of oil,—and shall pour it upon the palm of the priest’s left hand,
content_old: 15 and the priest shall take of the log of oil,—and shall pour it upon the palm of the priest’s left hand,

content: 16 and the priest shall dip his right finger and take of the oil that is on the palm of his left hand,—and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times､ before Yahweh:
content_old: 16 and the priest shall dip his right finger and take of the oil that is on the palm of his left hand,—and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times､ before Yahweh:

content: 17 and of the remainder of the oil which is on the palm of hs hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot,—upon the blood of the guilt-bearer;
content_old: 17 and of the remainder of the oil which is on the palm of hs hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot,—upon the blood of the guilt-bearer;

content: 18 and that which remaineth of the oil that is on the palm of the priest’s hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 18 and that which remaineth of the oil that is on the palm of the priest’s hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh.

content: 19 Then shall the priest offer the sin-bearer, and shall put a propitiatory-covering over him that is to be cleansed､ because of his uncleanness,—and afterwards shall he slay the ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 19 Then shall the priest offer the sin-bearer, and shall put a propitiatory-covering over him that is to be cleansed､ because of his uncleanness,—and afterwards shall he slay the ascending-sacrifice.

content: 20 And the priest shall cause the ascending-sacrifice, and the meal-offering to ascend at the altar,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ and he shall be clean.
content_old: 20 And the priest shall cause the ascending-sacrifice, and the meal-offering to ascend at the altar,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ and he shall be clean.

content: 21 But if he be poor and his hand hath not enough then shall he take one he-lamb as a guilt-bearer to be waved､ to put a propitiatory-covering over him,—and one-tenth of fine meal, overflowed with oil for a meal-offering､ and a log of oil,
content_old: 21 But if he be poor and his hand hath not enough then shall he take one he-lamb as a guilt-bearer to be waved､ to put a propitiatory-covering over him,—and one-tenth of fine meal, overflowed with oil for a meal-offering､ and a log of oil,

content: 22 and two turtle-doves or two young pigeons, for which his hand hath enough,—so shall one be a sin-bearer, and the other an ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 22 and two turtle-doves or two young pigeons, for which his hand hath enough,—so shall one be a sin-bearer, and the other an ascending-sacrifice.

content: 23 And he shall bring them in､ on the eighth day､ for his cleansing､ unto the priest,—unto the entrance of the tent of meeting､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 23 And he shall bring them in､ on the eighth day､ for his cleansing､ unto the priest,—unto the entrance of the tent of meeting､ before Yahweh.

content: 24 Then shall the priest take the guilt-bearing lamb and the log of oil,—and the priest shall wave them as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 24 Then shall the priest take the guilt-bearing lamb and the log of oil,—and the priest shall wave them as a wave-offering､ before Yahweh.

content: 25 Then shall the guilt-bearing lamb be slain, and the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-bearer, and put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed,—and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot;
content_old: 25 Then shall the guilt-bearing lamb be slain, and the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-bearer, and put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed,—and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot;

content: 26 also of the oil shall the priest pour out,—on the palm of his own left hand;
content_old: 26 also of the oil shall the priest pour out,—on the palm of his own left hand;

content: 27 and the priest shall sprinkle､ with his right finger, of the oil that is on the palm of his left hand,—seven times､ before Yahweh;
content_old: 27 and the priest shall sprinkle､ with his right finger, of the oil that is on the palm of his left hand,—seven times､ before Yahweh;

content: 28 then shall the priest put､ of the oil that is on the palm of his hand､ upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot,—upon the place of the blood of the guilt-offering;
content_old: 28 then shall the priest put､ of the oil that is on the palm of his hand､ upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot,—upon the place of the blood of the guilt-offering;

content: 29 and that which remaineth of the oil which is on the palm of the priest’s hand shall he put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed,—to put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 29 and that which remaineth of the oil which is on the palm of the priest’s hand shall he put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed,—to put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh.

content: 30 Then shall he offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons,—of that for which his hand hath enough;
content_old: 30 Then shall he offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons,—of that for which his hand hath enough;

content: 31 even that for which his hand hath enough,—the one as a sin-bearer and the other as an ascending-sacrifice､ upon the meal-offering,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him that is to be cleansed､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 31 even that for which his hand hath enough,—the one as a sin-bearer and the other as an ascending-sacrifice､ upon the meal-offering,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him that is to be cleansed､ before Yahweh.

content: 32 This is the law for him in whom hath been the plague of leprosy,—whose hand hath not enough､ for that which pertaineth to his cleansing.
content_old: 32 This is the law for him in whom hath been the plague of leprosy,—whose hand hath not enough､ for that which pertaineth to his cleansing.

content: 33 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 33 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 34 When ye enter into the land of Canaan which I am about to give you､ for a possession,—and I put a plagne-mark of leprosy in a house､ of the land of your possession,
content_old: 34 When ye enter into the land of Canaan which I am about to give you､ for a possession,—and I put a plagne-mark of leprosy in a house､ of the land of your possession,

content: 35 then shall he that owneth the house come in､ and tell the priest, saying,— A kind of plague-mark appeareth to me､ in the house;
content_old: 35 then shall he that owneth the house come in､ and tell the priest, saying,— A kind of plague-mark appeareth to me､ in the house;

content: 36 and the priest shall give command､ and they shall empty the house､ ere yet the priest cometh in to view the mark, so that he do not pronounce unclean all that is in the house,—and after this shall the priest come in､ to view the house:
content_old: 36 and the priest shall give command､ and they shall empty the house､ ere yet the priest cometh in to view the mark, so that he do not pronounce unclean all that is in the house,—and after this shall the priest come in､ to view the house:

content: 37 then shall he view the mark､ and lo! if the mark is in the walls of the house, with sunken places､ greenish yellow､ or reddish,—and they appear to be lower than the surface of the wall,
content_old: 37 then shall he view the mark､ and lo! if the mark is in the walls of the house, with sunken places､ greenish yellow､ or reddish,—and they appear to be lower than the surface of the wall,

content: 38 then shall the priest come forth out of the house､ unto the entrance of the house,—and shall shut up the house､ seven days;
content_old: 38 then shall the priest come forth out of the house､ unto the entrance of the house,—and shall shut up the house､ seven days;

content: 39 and the priest shall return on the seventh day,—and take a view, and lo! if the mark hath spread in the walls of the house,
content_old: 39 and the priest shall return on the seventh day,—and take a view, and lo! if the mark hath spread in the walls of the house,

content: 40 then shall the priest give command, and they shall pull out the stones, wherein is the mark,—and cast them forth outside the city, into an unclean place;
content_old: 40 then shall the priest give command, and they shall pull out the stones, wherein is the mark,—and cast them forth outside the city, into an unclean place;

content: 41 and the house itself shall he cause to be scraped on the inside､ round about,—and they shall pour out the mortar which they have scraped off, outside the city, into an unclean place;
content_old: 41 and the house itself shall he cause to be scraped on the inside､ round about,—and they shall pour out the mortar which they have scraped off, outside the city, into an unclean place;

content: 42 and shall take other stones, and put in the place of the stones,—and other mortar shall he take､ and plaster the house.
content_old: 42 and shall take other stones, and put in the place of the stones,—and other mortar shall he take､ and plaster the house.

content: 43 But if the mark again breaketh out in the house､ after the taking out of the stones,—and after the scraping of the house､ and after the plastering;
content_old: 43 But if the mark again breaketh out in the house､ after the taking out of the stones,—and after the scraping of the house､ and after the plastering;

content: 44 then shall the priest come in, and take a view, and lo! if the mark hath spread in the house a fretting leprosy it is in the house､ unclean it is,
content_old: 44 then shall the priest come in, and take a view, and lo! if the mark hath spread in the house a fretting leprosy it is in the house､ unclean it is,

content: 45 and he shall pull down the house,—the stones thereof､ and the timber thereof､ and all the mortar of the house,—and shall carry them forth outside the city, into an unclean place.
content_old: 45 and he shall pull down the house,—the stones thereof､ and the timber thereof､ and all the mortar of the house,—and shall carry them forth outside the city, into an unclean place.

content: 46 And as for him that entereth into the house, all the days it is shut up he shall be unclean､ until the evening;
content_old: 46 And as for him that entereth into the house, all the days it is shut up he shall be unclean､ until the evening;

content: 47 And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes, and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.
content_old: 47 And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes, and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.

content: 48 But though the priest do come into the house, and take a view yet lo! if the plague-mark hath not spread in the house after the house was plastered then shall the priest pronounce the house clean, for healed is the plague.
content_old: 48 But though the priest do come into the house, and take a view yet lo! if the plague-mark hath not spread in the house after the house was plastered then shall the priest pronounce the house clean, for healed is the plague.

content: 49 Then shall he take､ to cleanse the house､ two birds,—and cedar wood, and crimson､ and hyssop;
content_old: 49 Then shall he take､ to cleanse the house､ two birds,—and cedar wood, and crimson､ and hyssop;

content: 50 and shall kill one bird,—within an earthen vessel､ over living water;
content_old: 50 and shall kill one bird,—within an earthen vessel､ over living water;

content: 51 and take the cedar wood､ and the hyssop､ and the crimson､ and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the living water,—and sprinkle the house､ seven times;
content_old: 51 and take the cedar wood､ and the hyssop､ and the crimson､ and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the living water,—and sprinkle the house､ seven times;

content: 52 and so cleanse the house, with the blood of the bird､ and with the living water,—and with the living bird､ and with the cedar wood､ and with the hyssop, and with the crimson;
content_old: 52 and so cleanse the house, with the blood of the bird､ and with the living water,—and with the living bird､ and with the cedar wood､ and with the hyssop, and with the crimson;

content: 53 and shall let go the living bird unto the outside of the city､ unto the face of the field,—so shall he put a propitiatory-covering over the house､ and it shall be clean.
content_old: 53 and shall let go the living bird unto the outside of the city､ unto the face of the field,—so shall he put a propitiatory-covering over the house､ and it shall be clean.

content: 54 This is the law,— for every plague-mark of leprosy and for scall;
content_old: 54 This is the law,— for every plague-mark of leprosy and for scall;

content: 55 and for garment leprosy､ and for house leprosy;
content_old: 55 and for garment leprosy､ and for house leprosy;

content: 56 and for rising､ and for scab､ and for a bright spot;
content_old: 56 and for rising､ and for scab､ and for a bright spot;

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and ye shall say unto them,— When any man whatsoever hath a flowing from his flesh his flux is unclean.
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and ye shall say unto them,— When any man whatsoever hath a flowing from his flesh his flux is unclean.

content: 3 And this shall be his uncleanness､ in his flux,—whether his flesh is running with his flux､ or his flesh hath closed from his flux his uncleanness it is.
content_old: 3 And this shall be his uncleanness､ in his flux,—whether his flesh is running with his flux､ or his flesh hath closed from his flux his uncleanness it is.

content: 4 All the bed whereon he that hath the flux lieth shall be unclean,—and every piece of furniture whereon he sitteth shall be unclean.
content_old: 4 All the bed whereon he that hath the flux lieth shall be unclean,—and every piece of furniture whereon he sitteth shall be unclean.

content: 5 And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 5 And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 6 And he that sitteth on that whereon he that hath the flux hath sat shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 6 And he that sitteth on that whereon he that hath the flux hath sat shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 7 And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the flux shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 7 And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the flux shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 8 And when he that hath a flux spitteth on him that is clean then shall he wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 8 And when he that hath a flux spitteth on him that is clean then shall he wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 9 And every saddle whereon he that hath the flux rideth shall be unclean.
content_old: 9 And every saddle whereon he that hath the flux rideth shall be unclean.

content: 10 And whosoever toucheth anything that was under him shall be unclean､ until the evening; and he that carrieth them shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean, until the evening.
content_old: 10 And whosoever toucheth anything that was under him shall be unclean､ until the evening; and he that carrieth them shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean, until the evening.

content: 11 And whomsoever he that hath the flux toucheth, not having rinsed his hands in water then shall he wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 11 And whomsoever he that hath the flux toucheth, not having rinsed his hands in water then shall he wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 12 And the earthen vessel which he that hath the flux toucheth shall be broken in pieces,—and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
content_old: 12 And the earthen vessel which he that hath the flux toucheth shall be broken in pieces,—and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

content: 13 And when he that hath the flux becometh clean from his flux then shall he number to himself seven days for his cleansing､ and wash his clothes,—and bathe his flesh in living water､ and be clean.
content_old: 13 And when he that hath the flux becometh clean from his flux then shall he number to himself seven days for his cleansing､ and wash his clothes,—and bathe his flesh in living water､ and be clean.

content: 14 And on the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtle doves or two young pigeons,—and come in before Yahweh､ unto the entrance of the tent of meeting, and give them to the priest;
content_old: 14 And on the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtle doves or two young pigeons,—and come in before Yahweh､ unto the entrance of the tent of meeting, and give them to the priest;

content: 15 and the priest shall offer them, one as a sin-bearer､ and the other as an ascending-sacrifice,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh､ because of his flux.
content_old: 15 and the priest shall offer them, one as a sin-bearer､ and the other as an ascending-sacrifice,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over him､ before Yahweh､ because of his flux.

content: 16 And when there goeth out from any man an outflow of seed then shall he bathe all his flesh in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 16 And when there goeth out from any man an outflow of seed then shall he bathe all his flesh in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 17 And in the case of any garment or any skin whereupon there shall come to be an outflow of seed then shall it be washed in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 17 And in the case of any garment or any skin whereupon there shall come to be an outflow of seed then shall it be washed in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 18 Also a woman with whom man lieth carnally then shall they bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 18 Also a woman with whom man lieth carnally then shall they bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.

content: 19 And when a woman hath a flow, and ber flow in her flesh is blood seven days shall she continue in her removal, and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 19 And when a woman hath a flow, and ber flow in her flesh is blood seven days shall she continue in her removal, and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the evening;

content: 20 and whatsoever she lieth upon in her removal shall be unclean,—and whatsoever she sitteth upon shall be unclean;
content_old: 20 and whatsoever she lieth upon in her removal shall be unclean,—and whatsoever she sitteth upon shall be unclean;

content: 21 and whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 21 and whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening;

content: 22 and whosoever toucheth any thing whereon she sitteth shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 22 and whosoever toucheth any thing whereon she sitteth shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening;

content: 23 and whether on her bed it is､ or on any thing whereon she hath been sitting､ when he toucheth it he shall be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 23 and whether on her bed it is､ or on any thing whereon she hath been sitting､ when he toucheth it he shall be unclean until the evening;

content: 24 and if man shall even lie with her, and her cause for removal be upon him then shall he be unclean seven days,—and all the bed whereon he shall lie shall be unclean.
content_old: 24 and if man shall even lie with her, and her cause for removal be upon him then shall he be unclean seven days,—and all the bed whereon he shall lie shall be unclean.

content: 25 And when any woman’s flow of blood lasteth many days､ outside the time of her removal, or when it floweth beyond her removal all the days of her unclean flow shall she be as in the days of her removal—unclean she is.
content_old: 25 And when any woman’s flow of blood lasteth many days､ outside the time of her removal, or when it floweth beyond her removal all the days of her unclean flow shall she be as in the days of her removal—unclean she is.

content: 26 All the bed whereon she lieth during all the days of her flow like her bed in her removal shall be to her,—and every thing whereon she sitteth shall be unclean, like the uncleanness in her removal;
content_old: 26 All the bed whereon she lieth during all the days of her flow like her bed in her removal shall be to her,—and every thing whereon she sitteth shall be unclean, like the uncleanness in her removal;

content: 27 and whosoever toucheth them shall be unclean,—and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 27 and whosoever toucheth them shall be unclean,—and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be unclean until the evening.

content: 28 But if she be clean from her flow then shall she count to herself seven days､ and afterwards shall she count herself clean.
content_old: 28 But if she be clean from her flow then shall she count to herself seven days､ and afterwards shall she count herself clean.

content: 29 And on the eighth day shall she take to herself two turtle doves, or two young pigeons,—and bring them in unto the priest, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting;
content_old: 29 And on the eighth day shall she take to herself two turtle doves, or two young pigeons,—and bring them in unto the priest, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting;

content: 30 and the priest shall offer the one as a sin-bearer､ and the other as an ascending-sacrifice,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over her､ before Yahweh､ because of her unclean flow.
content_old: 30 and the priest shall offer the one as a sin-bearer､ and the other as an ascending-sacrifice,—so shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over her､ before Yahweh､ because of her unclean flow.

content: 31 Thus shall ye warn the sons of Israel from their uncleanness, And they shall not die in their uncleanness, By reason of their making unclean my habitation which is in their midst.
content_old: 31 Thus shall ye warn the sons of Israel from their uncleanness, And they shall not die in their uncleanness, By reason of their making unclean my habitation which is in their midst.

content: 32 This is the law— Of him that hath a flux,— And of him from whom goeth an outflow of seed､ making unclean thereby;
content_old: 32 This is the law— Of him that hath a flux,— And of him from whom goeth an outflow of seed､ making unclean thereby;

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron,—when they had offered strange fire before Yahweh､ and died.
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron,—when they had offered strange fire before Yahweh､ and died.

content: 2 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he do not come at all times into the holy place, within the veil,—into the presence of the propitiatory､ which is upon the ark､ so shall he not die, for in the cloud will I appear upon the propitiatory.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he do not come at all times into the holy place, within the veil,—into the presence of the propitiatory､ which is upon the ark､ so shall he not die, for in the cloud will I appear upon the propitiatory.

content: 3 Herewith shall Aaron come into the holy place,—With a bullock､ the choice of the herd､ as a sin-bearer, and a ram as an ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 3 Herewith shall Aaron come into the holy place,—With a bullock､ the choice of the herd､ as a sin-bearer, and a ram as an ascending-sacrifice.

content: 4 A holy tunic of linen shall he put on､ and drawers of linen shall be upon his flesh, and with a band of linen shall he gird himself, and with a turban of linen shall his head be wrapped about,—holy garments they are, therefore shall he bathe in water his flesh､ and so put them on.
content_old: 4 A holy tunic of linen shall he put on､ and drawers of linen shall be upon his flesh, and with a band of linen shall he gird himself, and with a turban of linen shall his head be wrapped about,—holy garments they are, therefore shall he bathe in water his flesh､ and so put them on.

content: 5 And from the assembly of the sons of Israel shall he receive two he-goats��� for bearing sin,—and one ram､ as an ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 5 And from the assembly of the sons of Israel shall he receive two he-goats��� for bearing sin,—and one ram､ as an ascending-sacrifice.

content: 6 Then shall Aaron bring near the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself,—and put a propitiatory-covering about himself､ and about his household.
content_old: 6 Then shall Aaron bring near the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself,—and put a propitiatory-covering about himself､ and about his household.

content: 7 Then shall he take the two goats,—and cause them to stand､ before Yahweh, at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 7 Then shall he take the two goats,—and cause them to stand､ before Yahweh, at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

content: 8 And Aaron shall cast lots over the two goats,—one lot for Yahweh, and one lot for Azazel.
content_old: 8 And Aaron shall cast lots over the two goats,—one lot for Yahweh, and one lot for Azazel.

content: 9 Then shall Aaron bring near the goat over which came up the lot for Yahweh,—and shall make of him a sin-bearer;
content_old: 9 Then shall Aaron bring near the goat over which came up the lot for Yahweh,—and shall make of him a sin-bearer;

content: 10 but the goat over which came up the lot for Azazel shall he cause to stand alive—before Yahweh､ to put a propitiatory-covering over him,—to send him away unto Azazel､ towards the desert.
content_old: 10 but the goat over which came up the lot for Azazel shall he cause to stand alive—before Yahweh､ to put a propitiatory-covering over him,—to send him away unto Azazel､ towards the desert.

content: 11 So Aaron shall bring near the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself, and shall put a propitiatory-covering about himself､ and about his household,—and shall slay the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself;
content_old: 11 So Aaron shall bring near the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself, and shall put a propitiatory-covering about himself､ and about his household,—and shall slay the sin-bearing bullock which is for himself;

content: 12 and shall take the censer-full of burning coals of fire from off the altar､ from before Yahweh, and his hands full of fragrant incense､ beaten small,—and bring within the veil;
content_old: 12 and shall take the censer-full of burning coals of fire from off the altar､ from before Yahweh, and his hands full of fragrant incense､ beaten small,—and bring within the veil;

content: 13 and shall put the incense upon the fire､ before Yahweh,—and the cloud of incense shall cover the propitiatory which is over the testimony､ and he shall not die.
content_old: 13 and shall put the incense upon the fire､ before Yahweh,—and the cloud of incense shall cover the propitiatory which is over the testimony､ and he shall not die.

content: 14 Then shall he take of the blood of the bullock, and shall sprinkle with his finger upon the face of the propitiatory､ eastwards,—and before the propitiatory shall he sprinkle seven times､ of the blood､ with his finger.
content_old: 14 Then shall he take of the blood of the bullock, and shall sprinkle with his finger upon the face of the propitiatory､ eastwards,—and before the propitiatory shall he sprinkle seven times､ of the blood､ with his finger.

content: 15 Then shall he slay the sin-bearing goat which is for the people, and bring in its blood､within the veil,—and do with its blood､ as he did to the blood of the bullock, and shall sprinkle it､ upon the propitiatory､ and before the propitiatory:
content_old: 15 Then shall he slay the sin-bearing goat which is for the people, and bring in its blood､within the veil,—and do with its blood､ as he did to the blood of the bullock, and shall sprinkle it､ upon the propitiatory､ and before the propitiatory:

content: 16 So shall he put a propitiatory-covering over the holy place､ because of the uncleanness of the sons of Israel, and because of their transgressions､ to the extent of all their sins,—and so shall he do for the tent of meeting, which abideth with them, in the midst of their uncleanness.
content_old: 16 So shall he put a propitiatory-covering over the holy place､ because of the uncleanness of the sons of Israel, and because of their transgressions､ to the extent of all their sins,—and so shall he do for the tent of meeting, which abideth with them, in the midst of their uncleanness.

content: 17 And no human being shall be in the tent of meeting､ when he cometh in to make a covering by propitiation in the holy place､ until he goeth out,—so shall he put a propitiatory-covering about himself and about his household､ and about all the convocation of Israel.
content_old: 17 And no human being shall be in the tent of meeting､ when he cometh in to make a covering by propitiation in the holy place､ until he goeth out,—so shall he put a propitiatory-covering about himself and about his household､ and about all the convocation of Israel.

content: 18 Then shall he go out unto the altar which is before Yahweh､ and shall put a propitiatory-covering there-upon,—and shall take of the blood of the bullock､ and of the blood of the goat, and put upon the horns of the altar､ round about;
content_old: 18 Then shall he go out unto the altar which is before Yahweh､ and shall put a propitiatory-covering there-upon,—and shall take of the blood of the bullock､ and of the blood of the goat, and put upon the horns of the altar､ round about;

content: 19 and shall sprinkle upon it､ of the blood､ with his finger､ seven times,—and shall cleanse it and hallow it, from the uncleannesses of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 19 and shall sprinkle upon it､ of the blood､ with his finger､ seven times,—and shall cleanse it and hallow it, from the uncleannesses of the sons of Israel.

content: 20 And when he hath made an end of covering by propitiation the holy place, and the tent of meeting､ and the altar then shall he bring near the living goat.
content_old: 20 And when he hath made an end of covering by propitiation the holy place, and the tent of meeting､ and the altar then shall he bring near the living goat.
